Yes, there are many Catalan movies and books that can provide insights into the region's culture, history, and way of life. Here are a few examples:

Catalan Films:
1. Pa Negre (Black Bread) - This film is a dark drama set in a rural village in Catalonia after the Spanish Civil War.

2. Estiu 1993 (Summer 1993) - A heartwarming coming-of-age tale set in the Catalan countryside, focusing on a young girl who struggles to adapt to her new life after her parents' death.

3. El mar (The Sea) - Based on a novel by Blai Bonet, this film is a haunting meditation on memory, youth, and love, set in the rugged beauty of the Catalan coast.

Catalan Books:
1. La plaça del diamant (The Time of the Doves) by Mercè Rodoreda - This novel is a classic of Catalan literature and tells the story of a woman's life during the Spanish Civil War and its aftermath.

2. Homage to Catalonia by George Orwell - Written in 1938, this non-fiction book is Orwell's personal account of his time fighting in the Spanish Civil War in Catalonia.

3. El carrer de les Camèlies (The Street of the Camellias) by Mercè Rodoreda - A poignant novel that tells the story of a young woman's journey to self-discovery and maturity set in the early 20th century Barcelona.

These are just a few examples of the many great Catalan films and books available. Discovering Catalan literature and cinema can be an enriching experience that can deepen one's understanding of the Catalan culture and people.
